channel.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I used to run my servers on port 5555, it had a nice ring to it tbh.

Read full topic
item.source: How often do you find a server on port 5555?

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:9, topic:432402”]I don’t really see why it matters to you so much. o.o I mean sure, the port may seem like it’s standardized at 43594, but it really doesn’t matter anymore since most servers have their own downloadable/web client, so you can host it on any port you want within reason.[/quote]It’s not for me. I’m opening a toplist and the site I’m looking at only allows 1 outgoing port to be open and I wanted to know how many people run servers on 5555. The most frequent I’ve seen is 43594.

Read full topic
item.source: How often do you find a server on port 5555?

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:13, topic:432402”]I’d just disable login.

Or perhaps change the login op-code. :rolleyes:[/quote]

What is probably easiest is what Demise PKing did, delete 50+ lines from client.java in your client.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:11, topic:432402”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=535113.msg3912470#msg3912470 date=1328892086]
I should release servers that have a bunch of random port numbers xD…could even rename the porting/ip stuff so nobody has an idea of what I’m referring to would be a good anti leech.
[/quote]

Anyone (with a brain) can decompile it, if it even is compiled lol.[/quote]obviously have not seen the general mopar population :o :o

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I don’t really see why it matters to you so much. o.o I mean sure, the port may seem like it’s standardized at 43594, but it really doesn’t matter anymore since most servers have their own downloadable/web client, so you can host it on any port you want within reason.

Read full topic
item.source: How often do you find a server on port 5555?

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

xI c E:

Never, unless the owner runs 2 worlds on the same IP and must use a different port, and in most cases it would be 5555.

Or you could have read my post.

Read full topic

item.title: How often do you find a server on port 5555?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:3, topic:432402”]What is the exact purpose of this topic?

Some people have multiple computers under one IP and want to host more servers. Therefore they’re going to use nonstandard ports. So what.[/quote]Top List :3

[quote=“Stupit, post:4, topic:432402”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=535113.msg3912024#msg3912024 date=1328837718]
35% of the time
[/quote]
I like to pull percentages out my ass too.
26.45% of the time I see a server with the port 5555.[/quote]Rofl

Read full topic
